title-group.article-title: Charge Air Cooling for Deutz Diesel Engines — System Arrangements and Effect on Performance and Emissions

permissions.copyright-statement: Copyright 1987 Society of Automotive Engineers, Inc.

abstract.p: High speed Deutz Diesel engines are characterized by modular design and air cooling. Turbocharged, charge air cooled engines feature an air-to-air cooler which is an integral part of the engine cooling system. Engine air cooling allows for two basically different charge air cooling system arrangements, whereby the cooler can be placed in-line or parallel to the engine cooling system. In this study, the characteristics of both arrangements are highlighted and their influence on the emission quality of the engine assessed. The comparison between both systems, related to the same engine rating, is based on the U. S. Transient Test Procedures. Furthermore the influence of different engine configurations and the engine temperature control system is described.

ref.mixed-citation: Garthe, H., The Deutz BF8L 51 3 Aircooled Diesel Engine with Exhaust Turbocharging for Truck and Bus Application, SAE Paper 85 2321
Reimold, H.W., Bauarten und Berechnung von Ladeluftkühlern für Otto-und Dieselmotoren, MTZ Motortechnische Zeitschrift 47 (1986)4
Richards, R.R., Caterpillar 3406B Air-To- Air Aftercooled Truck Engine, SAE Paper 85 1474
Schulz, B., Air-To-Air Charge Cooling For Navistar's 240 HP "Six", Diesel and Gasturbine, Feb. 1986
